sentences: Ta juba ootas meid üle poole tundi.
context: 'oot' is an imperative form of the verb 'to wait'. It is commonly used to tell someone to wait for a short period, either in person or by phone. The word can also be part of other expressions related to waiting, such as 'järgmisel kord' (next time) and 'ei jää' (does not remain).
